intro: Cereus treleasei, commonly known as the Christmas star cactus, is a species of cactus native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its short, thick stems and clusters of bright, showy flowers that bloom during the holiday season. The plant has spiny areoles and produces yellow or orange flowers that are often fragrant. Its leaves are typically reduced to small, scale-like structures, and it is well adapted to arid environments. Cereus treleasei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
